hw3

Class GameUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw3.GameUtil

  • public class GameUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class containing some elements of the basic logic for performing moves in a game of "Threes".

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameUtil()
      Constructor does nothing, since this object is stateless.

      • GameUtil

    • Method Detail

      • mergeValues

        public int mergeValues(int a,
                       int b)
        Returns the result of merging the two given tile values, or zero if they can't be merged. The rules are: a 1 can be merged with a 2, and two values greater than 2 can be merged if they match. The result of a merge is always the sum of the tile values.
        Parameters:
        a - given tile value
        b - given tile value
        Returns:
        result of merging the two values, or zero if no merge is possible

      • getScoreForValue

        public int getScoreForValue(int value)
        Returns the score for a single tile value. Tiles with value less than 3 have score zero. All other values result from starting with value 3 and doubling N times, for some N; the score is 3 to the power N + 1. For example: the value 48 is obtained from 3 by doubling N = 4 times (48 / 3 is 16, which is 2 to the 4th), so the score is 3 to the power 5, or 243.
        Parameters:
        value - tile value for which to compute the score
        Returns:
        score for the given gile value

      • initializeNewGrid

        public int[][] initializeNewGrid(int size,
                                 java.util.Random rand)
        Returns a new size x size array with two nonzero cells. The nonzero cells consist of a 1 and a 2, placed randomly in the grid using the given Random instance.
        Parameters:
        size - width and height of the new array
        rand - random number generator to use for positioning the nonzero cells
        Returns:
        new size x size array

      • calculateTotalScore

        public int calculateTotalScore(int[][] grid)
        Returns the total score for the given grid. The grid is not modified.
        Parameters:
        grid - given grid
        Returns:
        sum of scores for the values in the grid

      • copyGrid

        public int[][] copyGrid(int[][] grid)
        Makes a copy of the given 2D array. The array must be nonempty and rectangular.
        Parameters:
        grid - given 2D array to copy
        Returns:
        copy of the given array

      • generateRandomTileValue

        public int generateRandomTileValue(java.util.Random rand)
        Generate a new tile value using the given instance of Random. Values are generated such that there are 40% 1's, 40% 2's, 10% 3's, and 10% 6's.
        Parameters:
        rand - random number generator to use
        Returns:
        the value 1, 2, 3, or 6 with the specified probability

      • generateRandomTilePosition

        public api.TilePosition generateRandomTilePosition(int[][] grid,
                                                   java.util.Random rand,
                                                   api.Direction lastMove)
        Generates a position for a new tile. The new position is on the side of the grid opposite that of the previous move and is randomly selected from available positions in the given grid. The value of the tile is zero (typically filled in later by an associated Game instance). The given grid is not modified. If lastMove is null, this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        grid - given square array
        rand - random number generator to use
        lastMove - given direction
        Returns:
        new tile position

      • shiftArray

        public java.util.ArrayList<api.Move> shiftArray(int[] arr)
        Shifts the array elements to the left according to the rules of the Threes game. This method only operates on a one-dimensional array of integers representing the tile values in one row or column. The Game class can use this method to shift a row or column in any direction by copying that row or column, either forward or backward, into a temporary one-dimensional array to be passed to this method. The rules are that if there is a pair of adjacent cells that can be merged, and has no empty (zero) cells to its left, then the leftmost such pair of cells is merged and everything to its right is shifted left by one cell. Otherwise, if there is an empty cell, then everything to the right of the leftmost empty cell is shifted left by one cell. Otherwise, the array is unmodified and an empty list is returned.

        The new value for a pair of merged cells is determined by the method mergeValues. The method returns a list of Move objects representing the moved cells. All returned Move objects will have unspecified row/column and direction (typically filled in later by the associated Game instance). The list is in no particular order.

        Parameters:
        arr - array to be shifted
        Returns:
        list of all moves and/or merges performed in the shift
